title: Semi-supervised Object Detection: A Survey on Recent Research and Progress. (arXiv:2306.14106v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: In recent years, deep learning technology has been maturely applied in the field of object detection, and most algorithms tend to be supervised learning. However, a large amount of labeled data requires high costs of human resources, which brings about low efficiency and limitations. Semi-supervised object detection (SSOD) has been paid more and more attentions due to its high research value and practicability. It is designed to learn information by using small amounts of labeled data and large amounts of unlabeled data. In this paper, we present a comprehensive and up-to-date survey on the SSOD approaches from five aspects. We first briefly introduce several ways of data augmentation. Then, we dive the mainstream semi-supervised strategies into pseudo labels, consistent regularization, graph based and transfer learning based methods, and introduce some methods in challenging settings. We further present widely-used loss functions, and then we outline the common benchmark datasets and

Title: Semi-supervised Object Detection: A Survey on Recent Research and Progress. (arXiv:2306.14106v1 [cs.CV])
Abstract: In recent years, deep learning technology has been maturely applied in the field of object detection, and most algorithms tend to be supervised learning. However, a large amount of labeled data requires high costs of human resources, which brings about low efficiency and limitations. Semi-supervised object detection (SSOD) has been paid more and more attentions due to its high research value and practicability. It is designed to learn information by using small amounts of labeled data and large amounts of unlabeled data. In this paper, we present a comprehensive and up-to-date survey on the SSOD approaches from five aspects. We first briefly introduce several ways of data augmentation. Then, we dive the mainstream semi-supervised strategies into pseudo labels, consistent regularization, graph based and transfer learning based methods, and introduce some methods in challenging settings. translated_title: 半监督物体检测：最新研究和进展综述
translated_abstract: 近年来，深度学习技术已成熟应用于物体检测领域，大多数算法趋向于监督学习。然而，大量标记数据需要高昂的人力成本，导致低效率和限制。半监督物体检测 (SSOD) 因其高研究价值和实用性而越来越受到关注。它旨在通过使用少量标记数据和大量未标记数据学习信息。本文从五个方面全面而最新地介绍了 SSOD 方法。我们首先简要介绍了几种数据增强的方法。然后，我们将主流的半监督策略分为伪标签，一致性正则化，基于图形和基于迁移学习的方法，并介绍了一些在有挑战的情况下的方法。我们进一步介绍了广泛使用的损失函数，然后概述了常见的基准数据集和评估指标。最后，我们回顾了最近在 SSOD 上的进展并讨论了未来的潜在方向。
tldr: 本文综述并介绍了半监督物体检测 (SSOD) 的最新研究进展，主要包括数据增强方法，伪标签，一致性正则化，图形和迁移学习等半监督策略，并讨论了未来的研究方向和常用的评估指标。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a comprehensive survey on semi-supervised object detection (SSOD), which aims to use small amounts of labeled and large amounts of unlabeled data. The survey covers various SSOD approaches, including data augmentation, pseudo-labeling, consistent regularization, graph-based, and transfer learning-based methods. The paper also discusses common benchmark datasets and evaluation metrics, recent progress in SSOD, and potential future directions.
